newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST-Stora to post lower 9-mo profit.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Stora to post lower 9-mo profit.

text.p: Swedish forestry group Stora AB is expected to report a profit after financial items of 1.89 billion crowns for the first nine months of 1996, according to a Reuter poll of 16 analysts conducted on Tuesday.
This compares with a profit of 6.19 billion crowns in the first nine months of 1995. The sharp fall follows lower prices in the forestry sector.
The forecasts varied between 1.69 billion crowns and 2.09 billion with an average of 1.89 billion crowns.
For the full year 1996 the average of 14 analysts' forecast was for a profit of 2.63 billion crowns compared with 8.02 billion in 1995.
The average forecast for the full year has been lowered by 690 million crowns of 19 percent since a Reuter poll ahead of the half-year report.
For 1997 an average of 12 analysts' forecast saw profits at 3.28 billion crowns.
Of the analysts, 11 expected to see a weakening result in 1997 while one analyst forecast a better result.
